review_title: Strong Employer in a Difficult Field
job_title: Recruiter in New York, NY
pros: Care Design is a large organization fulfilling a niche need for folks with I/DD. There are a lot of opportunities for growth, but also a lot of folks looking to grow. Overall, you'll have an awful lot to do, but it's important work.
cons: There are a lot of rules and regulations that come down from the state and can be pretty large impediments to the work you need to do.

job_title: Care Manager in New York, NY
pros: Rewarding work in regards to helping people receive the services and support they need. CDNY has flexible hours which is a pro.
cons: Upper management, outside of care manager supervisors, do not care about the staff. Management only cares about billing and staff will be lectured about why someone hasn’t been billed for when it is ultimately out of the care managers hands if they can not contact anyone. There is no support from OPWDD and everything comes back to being the care managers fault. CDNY also hires people who have NO experience which isn’t bad, but they don’t train them. The sheer amount of incompetence when it comes to something so simple as proper grammar. In turn, care managers who know what they are doing, take over cases that have been handled correctly. It’s embarrassing to be the person to say “I’m sorry” all of the time when it was the previous persons mistake.

job_title: Care Manager in Albany, NY
pros: The pay scale is very fair compared to other non profits Mileage reimbursement Good IT department Flexible hours Fair time off/benefits package
cons: Constantly adding more and more mandatory documentation There is not always a lot of guidance available when needed. So many rules and SOP's you have to dog and dig to find what you need. Reimbursement for office supplies is terrible- especially when you don't have a local office to get supplies from.

review_title: Improving the lives of people with Intellectual and/or Developmental Disabilities
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Opportunity to have be a part of making real improvements to the lives of adults and children with Intellectual and/or Developmental Disabilities. Great team of like minded people who are mission focused. Specialty support teams provide expertise and broaden the impact of the work done.
cons: The work is based on the field, home and sometimes an office. Not a lot of time seeing co-workers or supervisors in person.

job_title: IT Help Desk in Albany, NY
pros: Teamwork is constantly promoted. Great leadership. Good relationship among peers. Good salary Excellent benefits
cons: Nothing to complain about .

job_title: Director in New York, NY
pros: Working from home good salary for middle management caring leadership
cons: overworked care managers & insufficient staffing ineffective HR department lack of sufficient staff too many meetings need for perfection getting in the way of completing basic tasks

job_title: Care Manager in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Not applicable, does not apply
cons: Too any cases assigned within 5 to 7 days No management support

review_title: A good place to work as long your very organized
job_title: Care Manager in Poughkeepsie, NY
pros: Flexible Schedule, great benefits, sometimes rewarding
cons: Very bureaucratic, constantly adding new responsibilities,

job_title: Care Manager in Central Islip, NY
pros:
Work from home
Flexibility
Nice supervisor
cons:
Horrible leadership
Forced to get vaccinated even though the job was remote
I was hired as a virtual employee then told we have to transition back into an office halfway through my employment

job_title: Assistant Vice President Care Management in New York, NY
pros: The leadership team at Care Design NY is focused on making work/life improvements for the care managers and their supervisory teams as well as the departments that partner with the care managers. They are are also dedicated to improving the lives of the people with I/DD through advocacy at both the personal level and with NY State Government. Great clinical team to support the care managers who face challenging situations.
cons: The workforce challenge for the field of I/DD makes finding good quality services very challenging.

job_title: Human Resources in New York, NY
pros: Ambition dependent motivated communication strong
cons: No raise long hours tired

job_title: Care Manager in Chestnut Ridge, NY
pros: Great supervision, teamwork and benefits. Work from home option sometimes.
cons: Technology sometimes had annoying issues

job_title: Care Manager in New York, NY
pros: Cool CMs. People we support are nice
cons: Vice Presidents are clueless at this time.

job_title: Care Manager in Farmingdale, NY
pros:
- Decent pay
-flexibility, perfect for working moms 
- holidays Off 
- pop up bonus 
- wellness sessions
- manageable caseload
cons:
- constant change 
- unpaid lunch 
- can not change career within the organization. Only growth within your role.

job_title: Recruiter in New York, NY
pros: Great environment with professional staff. The human resources department was fantastic in their training and onboarding.
cons: Compensation was below industry average

job_title: Care Manager in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Care design provides a lot of education and webinars to care managers. Have great supports in place and provide good benefits.
cons: Cons are that care managers are overwhelmed. Cases have been increased in the past 6 months. They give a lot of work without adequate time to complete tasks given.

job_title: Care Manager in New York, NY
pros: Work from home , Benefits, Shift Hours and Socialization
cons:
Large Caseload 
Little Pay 
No Real "leaders"

job_title: Director in Albany, NY
pros: Solid mission to support people with IDD
cons: Lack of strong leadership and vision

job_title: Care Manager in Central Islip, NY
pros: Work from home. Great coworkers, time off. Flexible hours
cons: Too much work and expectations, not enough pay

job_title: Care Manager in New City, NY
pros: Top Management values and supports employees
cons: Heavy work load but rewarding

job_title: Care Manager in New City, NY
pros: It was a good job
cons: The useless trainings were annoying

review_title: Salary and Benefits are good. Culture is changing
job_title: Care Manager in Farmingdale, NY
pros: Good Salary and Time off. Smaller clusters so supervisors can help more easily. Very supportive supervisors/upper management.
cons:
As a previous MSC, I feel like we are getting further and further away from the people we support.  It seems to be more about quantity over quality in terms of completing documentation. We are expected to be nurses/doctors and keep our people out of the hospital to reduce how much Medicaid pays.  The whole culture has changed. 

When we originally transferred from MSC, we were told smaller caseloads, but that seems to have been lost as our caseloads keep growing and more responsibilities keep being added.

Lots of technical issues that prevent us for completing our work.

review_title: Growing Company - Good to work for
job_title: Care Manager in New York, NY
pros:
Flexible schedule
Sign on bonus
Christmas bonus
401 k contribution
Paid time off and floating days
Management responses are quick. They are always willing to assist.
Many opportunities for growth
Good communication- Management releases information quickly especially for State/Federal requirements
Great team work-all Care Managers encountered are willing to share information and help solve issues together
cons:
While training is good their weekly webinars are way too much. Tuesday’s, Wednesday’s and Thursday’s 
Still experiencing glitches with system yet many deadlines

review_title: Do not work here if you want to maintain your sanity.
job_title: Care Manager in New York, NY
pros: Great Benefits and Tution Reimbursement.
cons: Overworked and only care billing money. They do not carr about their employees mental state.
